unnormalised: ## Lights, Camera, Festival! Your Guide to India's Film Fest Scene
normalised: ## Lights, Camera, Festival! Your Guide to India's Film Fest Scene

unnormalised: Hey Bollywood buffs and cinema connoisseurs! Ever wondered where the magic really happens BEFORE the box office roar? It's at film festivals, my friends! These aren't just about fancy red carpets and celeb spotting (though, let's be honest, that's part of the fun!). They're a celebration of storytelling, an incubator for new talent, and a chance to see movies you won't find anywhere else.
normalised: Hey Bollywood buffs and cinema connoisseurs! Ever wondered where the magic really happens before the box office roar? It's at film festivals, my friends! These aren't just about fancy red carpets and celeb spotting (though, let's be honest, that's part of the fun!). They're a celebration of storytelling, an incubator for new talent, and a chance to see movies you won't find anywhere else.

unnormalised: Think of it as a giant cultural mela for films. We're talking everything from indie gems shot on a shoestring budget to international masterpieces, from documentaries that'll make you think to shorts that'll leave you speechless. And India? We've got some of the coolest fests around.

unnormalised: Remember that award-winning documentary that your friend Ritu kept raving about? Chances are, it premiered at a film festival. Maybe even the Mumbai Film Festival (MAMI)! That’s a biggie, showcasing everything from edgy Indian cinema to international arthouse flicks.
normalised: Remember that award-winning documentary that your friend Ritu kept raving about? Chances are, it premiered at a film festival. Maybe even the Mumbai Film Festival (M A M I)! That’s a biggie, showcasing everything from edgy Indian cinema to international arthouse flicks.

unnormalised: But it's not just Mumbai. Imagine chilling in Goa in November at the International Film Festival of India (IFFI). Sun, sand, and cinema - sounds pretty amazing, right? Or heading up north for the Dharamshala International Film Festival (DIFF), surrounded by the Himalayas, soaking in stories from across the globe. Even Kolkata Film Festival is held in November/December.

unnormalised: These festivals are a breeding ground for independent filmmakers. They get their work seen, network with industry professionals, and maybe even get that big break. They give a platform like SRFTI gives to so many budding film makers. Plus, for us regular folks, it's a chance to broaden our cinematic horizons. It's like discovering a whole new world beyond the usual Karan Johar fare (no shade, KJo!).

unnormalised: So, next time you're looking for something different, skip the usual multiplex run and check out the film festival scene. You might just find your new favorite movie – and a whole new appreciation for the art of filmmaking. Who knows, maybe you'll even bump into a director and get a sneak peek at their next project! Just keep an eye on those dates and maybe budget around Rs. 5000 for travel and tickets. Some fests even have free screenings! Go explore, film fanatics! Maybe even get a bike and cycle around 5 km, festival hopping!.
